description:
I used to use a DOS VM with Windows 3.1 installed to play solitaire, (for real), but this circumvents this by ignoring the modern BS with the ads, micro-transactions, point systems, daily challenges, and all that nonsense.

It's like playing a game of Solitaire without the corporate bombardment of reminders of how capitalism run rampant corrupts even the most simple of things, because it is! Yay Linux!
I've loved this solitaire package on Fedora for many, many years and still do. Unfortunately, it refuses to launch on Silverblue.

Since upgrading to Gnome 42 it has forced UI back to Adwaita White. Even though my system is set to dark mode, what is this Windows lol. Otherwise has always and will always be a great app. can't wait for dark mode to work again. Gnome Libawaita light theme has always sucked bulls.
summary: Back to over riding Dark mode in Gnome 42, PUKE UI, but great game
Can't open it, can't close it

description: diese software kann nicht vom endless os entfernt werden.
